subject: Medicine
title: The Discovery of Anesthesia
description: A quick, practical guide to The Discovery of Anesthesia.

hook.text: Before 1846, surgery meant being held down while fully awake. Speed was the surgeon's greatest skill.

buildup.text: William Morton demonstrated ether anesthesia at Massachusetts General Hospital. The patient felt nothing.

discovery.text: The surgeon looked up and said, 'Gentlemen, this is no humbug.' Painless surgery had arrived.

twist.text: Three other people claimed they invented anesthesia first. The bitter priority dispute ruined Morton's life.

climax.text: Anesthesia didn't just end pain. It gave surgeons time to operate carefully instead of racing the clock.

punchline.text: Surgery became science when patients could sleep.

quiz.question: How did anesthesia change surgery beyond eliminating pain?
options: It gave surgeons time to operate carefully
It made surgeons less skilled over time
It eliminated the need for surgical training
